'''Taverners Hill MLR station''' is a planned light rail stop located adjacent to [[Parramatta Road]] at the border of the suburbs of [[Lewisham, New South Wales|Lewisham]], [[Summer Hill, New South Wales|Summer Hill]], [[Haberfield, New South Wales|Haberfield]] and [[Leichhardt, New South Wales|Leichhardt]] on the [[Metro Light Rail]] line in [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]]. The stop is planned for completion in 2012. The extension will make use of the former Rozelle branch of the [[Metropolitan Goods railway line]] heavy rail freight corridor and operate from the current light rail terminus at [[Lilyfield MLR station|Lilyfield]] to [[Dulwich Hill Interchange MLR station|Dulwich Hill]].http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/rail/lightrail-extension.htmlhttp://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/file/rail/SLRE-Community-Update-July-August-2010.pdf Taverners Hill is a well known locality name for the area located immediately to the east of the stop along Parramatta Road and extending up to Norton Street.[http://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/sites/default/files/publications/SLRE-Preliminary-Environmental-Assessment.pdf Sydney Light Rail Extension - Stage 1 - Inner West Extension - Preliminary Environmental Assessment.] Appendix A. Transport NSW. The stop is estimated to be used by 255 boarding passengers per weekday by 2016 with 95 of those arriving by bus.[http://majorprojects.planning.nsw.gov.au/files/61649/08_Environmental%20Assessment%20-%20Volume%201%20-%20Part%20C1%20-%20Chapter%2010.pdf Environmental Assessment - Volume 1 - Part C1 - Chapter 10.] Table 10.1 p 201. Transport NSW. ==Transport links== [[Sydney Buses]] runs three routes via Taverners Hill MLR station: *Route 461 - between [[Burwood railway station, Sydney|Burwood station]] and the City *Routes 480/483 - between [[Strathfield railway station|Strathfield station]] and the City ==Neighbouring Stops==
